subject: Climate & Environment
title: Your Home's Hidden Pollutants
description: A quick, practical guide to Your Home's Hidden Pollutants.

hook.text: Indoor air can be 2 to 5 times more polluted than outdoor air. And you spend 90% of time inside.

buildup.text: Cooking, cleaning products, candles, and furniture all release chemicals indoors.

twist.text: Modern homes are built airtight for energy efficiency, which traps pollutants inside.

climax.text: Opening windows for 10 minutes can cut indoor pollutant levels dramatically.

punchline.text: The most polluted room might be the one you're sitting in.
